module.name: Sulcal Skeletons
module.description:
This module compute the skeleton of sulcal regions.
References: Y. Shi, A. L. Reiss, A. D. Lee, R. A. Dutton, U. Bellugi, A. Galaburda, J. Korenberg, D. Mills, I. Dinov, P. M. Thompson, A. W. Toga, `` Hamilton-Jacobi skeletons on cortical surfaces with applications in characterizing the gyrification pattern in Williams syndrome'', Proc. ISBI, 2007

input.name: Cortical Surface Mesh
input.description: Input cortical surface

input.name: Mesh Segmentation
input.description: The segmentation result.

input.name: Sulcal or Gyral switch
input.description: 0: sulcal skeleton; 1: gyral skeleton.

input.name: Threshold
input.description: Default is 0.25. Typically in the range 0.1~0.5.

output.name: Output Skeleton
output.description: The generated skeleton in the format of a binary file with 1 indicates skeleton vertices and zero as background vertices.

module.license:
http://www.loni.ucla.edu/Software/license.php
By registering for downloads from the UCLA Laboratory of Neuro Imaging, you are agreeing to the following terms and conditions as well as to the Terms of Use of the LONI website. To view the LONI website's Terms of Use go to, http://www.loni.ucla.edu/software/termsofuse.php.

module.name: Graph Extraction
module.description: Extract the graph representionof skeletons on cortical surface.

input.name: Binary Skeleton File
input.description: A binary map that represents the Hamilton-Jacobi skeleton of sulcal regions.

output.name: Skeleton Branches
output.description: Graph representation of the skeleton with each branch composed of index of vertices on the triangular mesh.

module.name: Skeleton Pruning
module.description:
This module prune the skeletons to keep only the major branches.
References: Y. Shi, P. M. Thompson, I. Dinov, A. W. Toga, ``Hamilton-Jacobi Skeleton on Cortical Surfaces", submitted, 2007.

input.name: Skeleton Branches
input.description: The graph representation of the skeleton.

input.name: Length threshold
input.description: The minimum length of branches to keep in mm. Typically in the range 5~20.

output.name: Final Skeleton Lines
output.description: The final line represention of skeleton lines

input.name: Output option
input.description: 0: index of skeleton vertices 1: skeleton lines in obj format 2: skeleton lines in ucf format

module.license:

module.name: Gyral Skeletons
module.description: Same as the module of Sulcal Skeletons.

input.name: Cortical Surface Mesh
input.description: Input cortical surface.

input.name: Mesh Segmentation
input.description: The segmentation result.

input.name: Threshold
input.description: Default is 0.25.

module.name: Mesh To DTGrid
module.description:
Converts OBJ to DTG (a sparse representation of the narrow band around the zero level set for the implicit representation of the surface).
References:
M. B. Nielsen and K. Museth, "Dynamic Tubular Grid: An Efficient Data Structure and Algorithms for High Resolution Level Sets", Journal of Scientific Computing, Volume 26, Number 3, 2006.

input.name: Input file
input.description: Specifies the input (OBJ) file.

input.name: h
input.description: Specifies the h (number) parameter. Usually in the range 0.1~1.

input.name: bandwidth
input.description: Specifies the bandwidth (number) parameter. Usually in the range 3~5.

module.license:

module.name: Skeleton Pruning
module.description:
This module prune the skeletons to keep only the major branches.
References: Y. Shi, P. M. Thompson, I. Dinov, A. W. Toga, ``Hamilton-Jacobi Skeleton on Cortical Surfaces", submitted, 2007.

input.name: Skeleton Branches
input.description: The graph representation of the skeleton.

input.name: Length threshold
input.description: The minimum length of branches to keep in mm. Typically in the range 5~20.

output.name: Final Skeleton Lines
output.description: The final line represention of skeleton lines

input.name: Output option
input.description: 0: index of skeleton vertices 1: skeleton lines in obj format 2: skeleton lines in ucf format

module.license:

module.name: Implicit Surface Principal Curvatures
module.description: This module computes the principal curvatures for implicitly defined surfaces in the DTGrid format.

input.name: DTGrid Sparse Level Set Representation
input.description: DTGrid format of the implicitly represented surface.

input.name: Surface Mesh Representation
input.description: Triangular mesh representation of the surface.

input.name: Vert or Face Option
input.description: 0: Compute curvature at vertex 1: Compute curvature at the center of each face

module.license:

module.name: Graph-cut Mesh Segmentation
module.description:
This module computes a segmentation of the cortical surface into sulcal and gyral regions with a graph-cut method.
References: Y. Shi, A. L. Reiss, A. D. Lee, R. A. Dutton, U. Bellugi, A. Galaburda, J. Korenberg, D. Mills, I. Dinov, P. M. Thompson, A. W. Toga, " Hamilton-Jacobi skeletons on cortical surfaces with applications in characterizing the gyrification pattern in Williams syndrome'', Proc. ISBI, 2007
For Graph-cut implementation, we use the following open source code: ############################################ # # # MAXFLOW - software for computing mincut/maxflow in a graph # # Version 2.2 # # http://www.cs.cornell.edu/People/vnk/software.html # # # # Yuri Boykov (yuri@csd.uwo.ca) # # Vladimir Kolmogorov (vnk@cs.cornell.edu) # # 2001 # # # ############################################

input.name: Curvautre File
input.description: Curvature file estimated from the module "implicit surface principal curvatures".

input.name: Feature option
input.description: 0: mean curvature; 1: curvautre of maximum magnitude. 0 is preferred.

input.name: Smooth parameter
input.description: More smoothing when smaller value is used. Typical range: 0.5--1.

input.name: Neighborhood range
input.description: set as 1 to use 1-ring neighborhood

output.name: Segmentation Result
output.description: The mesh segmentation result in .raw format with 1 for sulcal region and 0 for gyral region.

module.license:

module.name: Reconstruct Sulcal/Gyral Regions
module.description: Using the pruned skeletons, generate a cleaner segementation of the sulcal and gyral regions.

input.name: GraphCut Seg Res
input.description: Graph-cut segmentation results.

input.name: PrunedSulcalSkeleton
input.description: Vertex indices of pruned sulcal skeletons.

input.name: PrunedGyralSkeleton
input.description: Vertex indices of pruned gyral skeletons.
